dcterms:creator: V. Panayotov
G. Chen
D. Povey
S. Khudanpur
dcterms:description: The LibriSpeech dataset is a large corpus of read English speech derived from audiobooks that are in the public domain, designed for automatic speech recognition (ASR) tasks.
dcterms:title: LibriSpeech

dcterms:creator: M. A. Pitt
K. Johnson
E. Hume
S. Kiesling
W. Raymond
dcterms:description: The Buckeye Corpus is a collection of conversational speech that includes labeling conventions and tests of transcriber reliability, useful for studying natural speech.
dcterms:title: Buckeye Corpus

dcterms:creator: N. J. De Vries
M. H. Davel
J. Badenhorst
W. D. Basson
F. De Wet
E. Barnard
A. De Waal
dcterms:description: The NCHLT Corpus is a dataset designed for automatic speech recognition (ASR) in under-resourced languages, collected using a smartphone-based tool.
dcterms:title: NCHLT Corpus

dcterms:creator: J. Kahn
M. Riviere
W. Zheng
E. Kharitonov
Q. Xu
P.-E. Mazar√©
J. Karadayi
V. Liptchinsky
R. Collobert
C. Fuegen
dcterms:description: Libri-light is a benchmark dataset for automatic speech recognition (ASR) that focuses on scenarios with limited or no supervision, providing a challenging environment for model evaluation.
dcterms:title: Libri-light

dcterms:creator: M. McAuliffe
M. Socolof
S. Mihuc
M. Wagner
M. Sonderegger
dcterms:description: The Montreal Forced Aligner is a tool for aligning text and speech, allowing for the automatic generation of word boundaries in audio recordings.
dcterms:title: Montreal Forced Aligner
